item.title: Writing Tools in Emacs - Emacs Writing Studio
item.description:
youtube

Emacs Writing Studio is a configuration of the GNU Emacs system for authors, students, researchers and anyone else who needs to manage written ideas. This video accompanies the Emacs Writing Studio website and book, demonstrating various tools for writers. Emacs Writing Studio Website: https://lucidmanager.org/productivity/denote-explore/ GitHub repository: https://github.com/pprevos/emacs-writing-studio/

item.title: C++ development in Emacs: clangd and eglot
item.description:
youtube

Here's how to set up Emacs for a better C++ development experience, in my opinion. clangd install instructions https://clangd.llvm.org/installation clangd features https://clangd.llvm.org/features eglot keybindings (use-package eglot :bind (:map eglot-mode-map ("C-c l r" . eglot-rename) ("C-c l a" . eglot-code-actions) ("C-c l f" . eglot-format))) if you're not using use-package (define-key eglot-mode-map (kbd "C-c l r") 'eglot-rename) (define-key eglot-mode-map (kbd "C-c l a") 'eglot-code-actions) (define-key eglot-mode-map (kbd "C-c l f") 'eglot-format)

item.title: showcase of outline-minor-mode and imenu in the eshell buffer
item.description:
youtube

(setq eshell-prompt-regexp "^.* Œª ") ;; modify according to your prompt (add-hook 'eshell-mode-hook 'outline-minor-mode) (add-hook 'eshell-mode-hook (lambda () (setq-local outline-regexp (concat eshell-prompt-regexp ".*")))) (add-hook 'eshell-mode-hook (lambda () (setq-local imenu-generic-expression `(("Prompt" ,(concat eshell-prompt-regexp "\\(.*\\)") 1)))))

item.title: The Most Simple Emacs Mode to Interact With OpenAI/ChatGPT API | lesson 11
item.description:
youtube

Free PDF and course üëâ https://tonyaldon.com/chatgpt-emacs-integration-course/ ----- We set up the *chatgpt* buffer to enter our prompts, positioning it neatly at the bottom of the frame for easy access. üñ•Ô∏è By defining chatgpt-mode, we customize this buffer's behavior and appearance, making it the perfect spot to interact with ChatGPT seamlessly within Emacs. - Displaying the Prompt Buffer with chatgpt - Defining chatgpt-mode - Introducing chatgpt-model Variable - Mode Line of the Prompt Buffer - Executing chatgpt-mode Once - Creating chatgpt-dir in chatgpt-mode - Defining chatgpt-mode-map keymap ----- Hi there! üëã I'm Tony Aldon, a passionate Emacs enthusiast dedicated to helping you master Emacs and Emacs Lisp. Join me on an exciting journey with the ChatGPT Emacs Integration Course and master the art of building a fully functional Emacs package from scratch. üåü Through - 18 engaging lessons, - 2.5 hours video content and - 100 pages of PDF you'll: - Master Emacs Lisp: üõ†Ô∏è Customize and extend Emacs like a pro. - Integrate ChatGPT Seamlessly: ü§ñ Enhance your workflow with advanced AI features using the OpenAI API. It can help if you know a little bit of Emacs Lisp, but this is not a requirement as we'll meticulously write, review, and comment on each line of code. üìù

item.title: Markdown to Org: Ex-NeovimConf Speaker Converts Me | Theena Kumaragurunathan
item.description:
youtube

In this clip I ask Theena what his thoughts are in regards to markdown, Theena used to manage a Neovim config called OVIwrite, and that's where he did most of his writing. Not so long ago, he discovered Emacs and has then switched completely from Neovim to Emacs, so after talking in multiple NeovimConf events, he now uses emacs and org files as his preferred format for writing, he left the good old markdown behind. Me on the other hand have no experience with org, but I do see the benefits, the variable font usage in a single file, and also variable font sizes amongst one of the few features. Link to the full interview: https://youtu.be/5W0bcoFkvLY --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- If you're not a YouTube member yet, you can join here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrSIvbFncPSlK6AdwE2QboA/join Join me in discord https://discord.gg/NgqMgwwtMH Start your setap 7 day free trial (my affiliate link) https://setapp.sjv.io/QjKK1a Start your 1password 14 day free trial (my affiliate link) https://www.dpbolvw.net/click-101327218-15917064 If you find this video helpful and want to support me https://ko-fi.com/linkarzu Follow me on twitter https://x.com/link_arzu My dotfiles (remember to star them) https://github.com/linkarzu/dotfiles-latest

item.title: Bare-bones Emacs starter setup
item.description:
youtube

Here's a very very basic config to make Emacs it look nice, in my opinion. ``` ;; remove window decorations (menu-bar-mode -1) (tool-bar-mode -1) (scroll-bar-mode -1) (load-theme 'modus-vivendi) ;; set mini-buffer completion mode (fido-vertical-mode) ;; change where file backups are created (setq backup-directory-alist '(("." . "~/.emacs.d/backups"))) ``` 0:04 open init file 0:20 remove bars 0:42 set color theme 0:57 minibuffer completion mode 2:08 backup files

item.title: Emacs org mode changelog for your github repositories
item.description:
youtube

Using emacs org model with src blocks we will create a changelog for your github repositories, showing the git hash, commit message, time and date of the commit and the repository status You can also set a todo status on the git repo in emacs to indicate the machine you have made the changes on, so you know which other machines you need to pull the changes to, you can then add a todo entry showing you have pulled the changes to that machine We with be using noweb to simplify the code and pass in variables for the local path to the git repo, from the src code block for each repo And we will wrap the results in a quote block so they are rendered on github as well changelog git repository https://github.com/NapoleonWils0n/changelog show the git sha sum of local and remote git repositories https://github.com/NapoleonWils0n/cerberus/blob/master/git/show-sha-sum.org

item.title: Curious and Obsessive | My Emacs For Writers handbook
item.description:
youtube

Finally, after many years of using Emacs for writing, I have assembled what I believe are the key points necessary to take any non-programmer writer gently by the hand into Emacs. DOWNLOAD HERE: https://chris-maiorana.kit.com/products/emacs-for-writers This handbook goes ALL THE WAY from ‚ÄúWhy plain text‚Äù to exporting your Org Mode files to crisp, standard manuscript Microsoft Word formatted documents for the writer‚Äôs market. If you are a technical writer, blogger, copywriter, novelist, or just a weekend short story writer like yours truly, Emacs is the superior composition and editing tool you need to more easily get your ideas out of your head and into the world.

item.title: Emacs buffer navigation
item.description:
youtube

Explains how I navigate in the buffer
